discover.instruction: Read the questions and how they are reported. Notice the word order.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай вопросы и как они передаются. Обрати внимание на порядок слов.

content.text:
Direct: '<highlight>Where do</highlight> you live?'
Reported: She asked <highlight>where I lived</highlight>.

Direct: '<highlight>Are</highlight> you happy?'
Reported: He asked <highlight>if I was</highlight> happy.

Direct: '<highlight>What are</highlight> you doing?'
Reported: She asked <highlight>what I was</highlight> doing.

Direct: '<highlight>Have</highlight> you finished?'
Reported: He asked <highlight>if I had</highlight> finished.

Direct: '<highlight>Will</highlight> you help me?'
Reported: She asked <highlight>if I would</highlight> help her.
content.question: What happens to word order in reported questions? Do we use question marks?
content.question_ru: Что происходит с порядком слов в косвенных вопросах? Используем ли мы вопросительные знаки?

theory.title: Reported Questions - Word Order and If/Whether
theory.title_ru: Косвенные вопросы - Порядок слов и If/Whether

points.rule: Wh-questions: asked + wh-word + subject + verb (statement order)
points.rule_ru: Wh-вопросы: asked + вопр. слово + подлежащее + глагол (порядок утверждения)
points.example: 'Where do you work?' → She asked where I worked.

points.rule: Yes/No questions: asked + if/whether + subject + verb
points.rule_ru: Да/Нет вопросы: asked + if/whether + подлежащее + глагол
points.example: 'Are you tired?' → He asked if I was tired.

points.rule: No question marks in reported questions
points.rule_ru: Нет вопросительных знаков в косвенных вопросах
points.example: She asked where I lived. (NOT: where I lived?)
'What do you want?' → asked what I wanted (NOT: what did I want)

points.rule_ru: То же изменение времён, что и в утверждениях
points.example: is → was, will → would, have → had

comparison_table.reported: asked if I had seen it

notice.instruction: Find all reported questions. What changed from the original question?
notice.instruction_ru: Найди все косвенные вопросы. Что изменилось по сравнению с оригинальным вопросом?

tasks.text:
At the interview, the manager asked many questions:

He asked what my name was. (What is your name?)
He asked where I had studied. (Where did you study?)
He asked if I had any experience. (Do you have any experience?)
He asked why I wanted this job. (Why do you want this job?)
He asked when I could start. (When can you start?)
He asked whether I would relocate. (Will you relocate?)
He asked how much I expected to earn. (How much do you expect to earn?)
He asked if I had any questions. (Do you have any questions?)

notice.reflection_question: Why don't we use 'do/does/did' in reported questions?
notice.reflection_question_ru: Почему мы не используем 'do/does/did' в косвенных вопросах?

sentences.reported: She asked what time the train left.

sentences.reported: He asked if I had been there before.

sentences.direct: 'Why did you leave your job?' she asked.
sentences.reported: She asked why I had left my job.
He asked if I could speak French.
She asked where I was going.
He asked if I would help him.

sentences.sentence: 'Where is the station?' → She asked ___ the station ___.
'What are you reading?' → She asked ___ I ___ reading.
'Have you finished?' → He asked ___ I ___ finished.
'Why did you call?' → She asked ___ I ___ called.
'Will you come?' → He asked ___ I ___ come.
'How old are you?' → She asked how old I ___.

sentences.explanation: No 'did' in reported questions, statement word order

sentences.incorrect: He asked do I like coffee?
sentences.correct: He asked if I liked coffee.

sentences.incorrect: She asked me what is my name.
sentences.correct: She asked me what my name was.

produce.instruction: Report questions from an interview, conversation, or quiz.
produce.instruction_ru: Передай вопросы из интервью, разговора или викторины.
prompts: Report questions from a job interview
Report questions a friend asked you
Report questions from a survey or quiz
Report questions a doctor or official asked
produce.example: Yesterday I had a job interview. The interviewer asked many questions. First, she asked what my name was and where I came from. Then she asked if I had worked in this field before. She wanted to know why I was interested in the position. She asked how I would handle difficult situations. She also asked whether I could work weekends. Finally, she asked when I could start if I got the job. She asked if I had any questions for her.
criteria: Uses statement word order in reported questions
No question marks in reported questions

texts.title: Customs at the Airport
texts.content: When I arrived at the airport, the customs officer asked many questions. He asked where I had come from. He wanted to know how long I was planning to stay. He asked if I had anything to declare. He asked whether I was traveling for business or pleasure. He asked what was in my bag. He asked if I had visited any farms recently. Finally, he asked where I would be staying. I answered all his questions and he let me through.

texts.title: First Date Questions
texts.content: On our first date, we asked each other many questions. She asked what I did for work. I asked where she had grown up. She wanted to know if I had any siblings. I asked whether she liked traveling. She asked what my hobbies were. I asked if she had seen any good movies lately. She asked why I had chosen this restaurant. I asked what kind of music she listened to. It was a great conversation!

texts.title: Police Investigation
texts.content: The detective interviewed the witness carefully. He asked where she had been at 9 PM. She said she had been at home. He asked if she had seen anything unusual. She mentioned she had heard a loud noise. He asked what the noise had sounded like. He wanted to know if she had looked outside. He asked whether she could describe anyone. He asked how long the incident had lasted. He asked if she would recognize the suspect again.

texts.title: Market Research Survey
texts.content: A researcher stopped me on the street. She asked if I had a few minutes. She asked how often I shopped online. She wanted to know what products I usually bought. She asked whether I preferred shopping online or in stores. She asked how much I spent on average each month. She asked if I was satisfied with delivery services. She asked what would make me shop more online. Finally, she asked how old I was.

texts.title: Parent Interrogation
texts.content: I came home late and my parents were waiting. Mom asked where I had been. Dad asked why I hadn't called. Mom wanted to know if I had been safe. Dad asked whether I had been drinking. I said I hadn't. Mom asked who I had been with. She asked if I could show her my phone. Dad asked when I would learn to be more responsible. I apologized and promised I would call next time.
